title: Disjunction is Commutative
description:
Prove that logical OR is commutative: `P \/ Q -> Q \/ P`.

**Goal:** `forall P Q : Prop, P \/ Q -> Q \/ P`

To work with disjunctions in Coq:
- Use `destruct` to case-split on a disjunction hypothesis
- Use `left` to prove the left side of a disjunction goal
- Use `right` to prove the right side of a disjunction goal
hints: Use `intros` to introduce P, Q, and the hypothesis P \/ Q
Use `destruct` on the disjunction hypothesis to get two cases
In each case, decide whether Q or P holds and use `left` or `right`
template:
Theorem or_commutative : forall P Q : Prop, P \/ Q -> Q \/ P.
Proof.
  (* Your proof here *)
Admitted.
solution:
Theorem or_commutative : forall P Q : Prop, P \/ Q -> Q \/ P.
Proof.
  intros P Q H.
  destruct H as [HP | HQ].
  - right. exact HP.
  - left. exact HQ.
Qed.
